[h1] There is a hope yet [/h1]
After the terrible dumbster fire that was vanguard and bf 2042, it's a refreshing change to see a somewhat competent release, so let's break it down

[h1]Story[/h1]
It can be a little cheesy at some points but it is quite enjoyable and comparable to MW, I liked most of the characters, even though ghost felt a bit overdone as if they were trying to make him more stand out then the original, but I would say good 8 hours spent

[h1]Multiplayer[/h1]
What new can be said, I really like the new invasion mode that brings bots alongside of you that makes the maps more seem like a huge battlefields, though real shame there is no community playlist like gun game, drop zone or infected, otherwise it's a solid mode, and I like the rewamped gunsmith

[h1]Spec-ops[/h1]
Well this one it tragic, I really miss the old spec ops which I sunk hours into this release plagues the same problem like the MW, aimbot deadly bots, unkillable juggernauts, and only 3 MAPS WHAT THE HELL! If you want to buy this game for this DON'T!

[h1] Rating [/h1]

Overall 7/10
Graphics 8/10
Maps 8/10
Realism(physics) 5/10
Realism(guns) 8/10
Sound design 10/10

I would recomend nice story and mindless fun on multiplayer.

DMZ is garbage.

I am only evaluating the single player part of the game beforehand. I don't play multiplayer in COD because I don't enjoy it (I played the last MP in CoD 2). So I'll start - A real Hollywood-style action blockbuster, as Infinity Ward has been doing for years. Excellent quality cinematics, unfortunately the game is boring and gray. A better campaign compared to MW 2019, but again a stealer of quotes (like no Russian etc.) and missions (Pripjat mission etc.) from the original MW trilogy. Again you will complete missions with the AC-130, again you will crawl under trucks, again you will avoid patrols in a ghillie suit. The authors are not creative and rely on nostalgia from the previous MW trilogy. Following the example of MW 2019, again a smaller political campaign (strong female characters and the kissing of their asses by Captain Price and his gang, yes I'm looking at you Farah ğŸ¤¢), however, there is less of it than in MW 2019. As for the composition of the missions, there are enough of them and they take about 5-8 hours (on a higher difficulty and a little longer, I finished it on Hardened). As for the AI, it is again stupid  and they run in front of the barrel for slaughter. Unfortunately, they dragged in the evil from Warzone and that is Armor suit . 90% of the AI â€‹â€‹in the missions is armored and they won't fall for a few shots, you have to shoot the whole magazine into them to damage their armor a bit before you can take them down. Such smaller Juggernauts from multiplayer, which makes some missions unplayable on higher difficulty, you will fall immediatelly on one round, they won't even fit on two magazines and you have 5 AI of them around you. So my final verdict is that I recommend the game mainly to those who also play MP, if you want to play it just for the singleplayer, wait for the discount. The game doesn't really justify the 70â‚¬. I'll probably get play the original trilogy now, which was 10x better.
